response_text: Got it ‚Äî here are reliable ways to get live transcription while streaming or watching videos, kept tight üëá  üß† Best overall (system-wide captions)  Google Live Transcribe (Android)  ‚Ä¢ Captions any audio playing on your phone (YouTube, Netflix, livestreams, Zoom, etc.)  Microsoft Windows 11 ‚Äì Live Captions  ‚Ä¢ Real-time captions for all system audio (browser, apps, streams)  ‚Ä¢ Offline, very accurate  Apple macOS ‚Äì Live Captions (Ventura+)  ‚Ä¢ Works system-wide (Safari, Chrome, VLC, streaming sites)  üåê Browser-based (quick & flexible)  Google Chrome ‚Äì Live Caption  ‚Ä¢ Built-in, works on most video players  ‚Ä¢ Settings ‚Üí Accessibility ‚Üí Live Caption  Otter.ai  ‚Ä¢ Can listen to system audio (paid tier)  ‚Ä¢ Great accuracy + searchable text  üé• Streaming platforms (native captions)  YouTube Live Captions  ‚Ä¢ Auto-generated, real-time (quality varies)  Twitch Closed Captions  ‚Ä¢ Depends on streamer enabling it  üß© Advanced / pro setups  OBS Studio + Speech-to-Text plugin  ‚Ä¢ Best if you‚Äôre recording or streaming yourself  Web Captioner  ‚Ä¢ Works with virtual audio cable (desktop)  ‚ö° Quick recommendation  Windows? ‚Üí Windows 11 Live Captions  Mac? ‚Üí macOS Live Captions  Android? ‚Üí Google Live Transcribe  Just YouTube/Chrome? ‚Üí Chrome Live Caption  If you want, tell me your device + where you watch (browser/app) and I‚Äôll give you the fastest exact setup.
